text: Doesn t it make more sense to kill myself now than witness the apocalypse  Throwaway  I don t want family and friends finding this   Yeah the world is completely screwed  I ve just gotten out of a   month long panic attack where I was convinced I convinced I had a disease of some sort  turns out it was all my anxiety physically hurting me  Well one the biggest triggers for that  aside form the pandemic  was the Aussie fires  I ve always been scared of climate change but I used to pull myself through by believing we had time and that eventually  world leaders would see it doesn t make sense to ignore it anymore  After the reaction towards the fires my faith in a future completely shattered  You  cannot  convince me we re not in the endgame anymore  People  like my family and friends  are gonna die slow and horrible deaths  wondering why God s abandoned them while world leaders go hide in their bunkers and get a few more years in their belt   So the Aussie fires and the pandemic and other shit in my country literally broke  I physically couldn t get out of bed some days because I d see nothing but everyone I love dying in painful ways   I dunno how I got out of it  but I don t  want  to go through that again  I m seeing the symptoms again  the tremors  the spikes of fear  the running thoughts It d be better to just off myself now than have my nightmare come true  Cause it s gonna come true and I can t stand being the only one believing it   Unless you can prove to me there s a future  what s the point in staying   Life s gonna get worse
summary: The Aussie fires and the pandemic made Throwaway's faith in the future completely shattered. He doesn't want to see his family and friends die. He wants to kill himself now rather than witness the apocalypse. He can't stand being the only one who believes in a future.
